Submodules¶

fxtrade.analysis module¶

Basic analysis tools for FX trade.

fxtrade.analysis.log10(df: DataFrame, copy=True) → DataFrame[ソース]¶

Return a dataframe which is applied numpy.log10 on columns ['open', 'close', 'high', 'low', 'volume']. Copy will be created if copy is True (default True).

fxtrade.analysis.diff(xs: Series) → Series[ソース]¶

Return xs.diff().dropna().

fxtrade.analysis.emaverage(xs: Series, alpha: float, dt: Timedelta) → Series[ソース]¶

Return exponential moving average of xs.

パラメータ

  • xs (pandas.Series) -- Contains data which should be calculated EMA. Its index must be type of pandas.DatetimeIndex.

  • alpha (float) -- The degree of weighting decrease. Between 0.8 to 0.9 recommended.

  • dt (pandas.Timedelta) -- Unit time. Weights decrease exponentially at a rate of alpha per unit time.

fxtrade.analysis.emvariances(xs: Series, alpha: float, dt: Timedelta)[ソース]¶

Return exponential moving average of (xs - ema) ** 2. Strictly speaking, this is not volatility, but it can be considered as some kind of historical volatility (easy to calculate).

パラメータ

  • xs (pandas.Series) -- Contains data which should be calculated EMV. Its index must be type of pandas.DatetimeIndex.

  • alpha (float) -- The degree of weighting decrease. Between 0.8 to 0.9 recommended.

  • dt (pandas.Timedelta) -- Unit time. Weights decrease exponentially at a rate of alpha per unit time.

fxtrade.analysis.infinite_trade_result(low: Series, low_base: Series, high: Optional[Series] = None, high_base: Optional[Series] = None, f_time_to_sell: Optional[Callable[[Series, Series], Series]] = None, f_time_to_buy: Optional[Callable[[Series, Series], Series]] = None) → float[ソース]¶

Return how much you can make profit if you buy a fixed amount of stock always when you should buy and you sell a fixed amount of stock always when you should sell. You sell some when low > low_base and You buy some when high < high_base. Note that the logarithm should be taken for both low and high.

パラメータ

  • low (pandas.Series) -- Contains logarithm of historical low price of the stock.

  • low_base (pandas.Series) -- Contains the criterion of sell timing.

  • high (pandas.Series, optional) -- Contains logarithm of historical high price of the stock. Will be overwritten by low when it's None.

  • high_base (pandas.Series, optional) -- Contains the criterion of buy timing. Will be overwritten by low_base when it's None.

  • f_time_to_sell (Optional[Callable[[pd.Series, pd.Series], pd.Series]], default (lambda low, low_base: low > low_base)) -- Be called as f_time_to_sell(low, low_base) and returns when you should sell.

  • f_time_to_buy (Optional[Callable[[pd.Series, pd.Series], pd.Series]], default (lambda high, high_base: high < high_base)) -- Be called as f_time_to_buy(high, high_base) and returns when you should buy.

fxtrade.analysis.sell_buy_timing_ratio(low: Series, low_base: Series, high: Optional[Series] = None, high_base: Optional[Series] = None, f_time_to_sell: Optional[Callable[[Series, Series], Series]] = None, f_time_to_buy: Optional[Callable[[Series, Series], Series]] = None) → float[ソース]¶

Return the ratio of the sell timing counts to the buy timing counts. Return numpy.nan when buy timing counts is 0 because you have no chance to buy the stock and this indicator is completely meaningless. This indicator should be close to 1 because the risk of losing a lot of money or getting salted is reduced if the chances of selling and buying are the same.

パラメータ

  • low (pandas.Series) -- Contains logarithm of historical low price of the stock.

  • low_base (pandas.Series) -- Contains the criterion of sell timing.

  • high (pandas.Series, optional) -- Contains logarithm of historical high price of the stock. Will be overwritten by low when it's None.

  • high_base (pandas.Series, optional) -- Contains the criterion of buy timing. Will be overwritten by low_base when it's None.

  • f_time_to_sell (Optional[Callable[[pd.Series, pd.Series], pd.Series]], default (lambda low, low_base: low > low_base)) -- Be called as f_time_to_sell(low, low_base) and returns when you should sell.

  • f_time_to_buy (Optional[Callable[[pd.Series, pd.Series], pd.Series]], default (lambda high, high_base: high < high_base)) -- Be called as f_time_to_buy(high, high_base) and returns when you should buy.

fxtrade.analysis.switch_count(low: Series, low_base: Series, high: Optional[Series] = None, high_base: Optional[Series] = None, f_time_to_sell: Optional[Callable[[Series, Series], Series]] = None, f_time_to_buy: Optional[Callable[[Series, Series], Series]] = None) → int[ソース]¶

Return the number of times the time to sell and the time to buy have switched. The higher this value, the more stock trading opportunities you have.

パラメータ

  • low (pandas.Series) -- Contains logarithm of historical low price of the stock.

  • low_base (pandas.Series) -- Contains the criterion of sell timing.

  • high (pandas.Series, optional) -- Contains logarithm of historical high price of the stock. Will be overwritten by low when it's None.

  • high_base (pandas.Series, optional) -- Contains the criterion of buy timing. Will be overwritten by low_base when it's None.

  • f_time_to_sell (Optional[Callable[[pd.Series, pd.Series], pd.Series]], default (lambda low, low_base: low > low_base)) -- Be called as f_time_to_sell(low, low_base) and returns when you should sell.

  • f_time_to_buy (Optional[Callable[[pd.Series, pd.Series], pd.Series]], default (lambda high, high_base: high < high_base)) -- Be called as f_time_to_buy(high, high_base) and returns when you should buy.

fxtrade.analysis.switch_ratio(low: Series, low_base: Series, high: Optional[Series] = None, high_base: Optional[Series] = None, f_time_to_sell: Optional[Callable[[Series, Series], Series]] = None, f_time_to_buy: Optional[Callable[[Series, Series], Series]] = None) → int[ソース]¶

Return the ratio of switch_count to (len(low) - 1) // 2. The higher this value, the more stock trading opportunities you have. This value is normalized to have a maximum value of 1 and is often more useful than switch_count.

パラメータ

  • low (pandas.Series) -- Contains logarithm of historical low price of the stock.

  • low_base (pandas.Series) -- Contains the criterion of sell timing.

  • high (pandas.Series, optional) -- Contains logarithm of historical high price of the stock. Will be overwritten by low when it's None.

  • high_base (pandas.Series, optional) -- Contains the criterion of buy timing. Will be overwritten by low_base when it's None.

  • f_time_to_sell (Optional[Callable[[pd.Series, pd.Series], pd.Series]], default (lambda low, low_base: low > low_base)) -- Be called as f_time_to_sell(low, low_base) and returns when you should sell.

  • f_time_to_buy (Optional[Callable[[pd.Series, pd.Series], pd.Series]], default (lambda high, high_base: high < high_base)) -- Be called as f_time_to_buy(high, high_base) and returns when you should buy.

fxtrade.analysis.estimate_laplace_param(xs: Series) → Tuple[float, float][ソース]¶

Return the maximum likelihood estimate of the parameters of Laplace distribution assuming that the input follows to it. First-order differences in currency price movements tend to follow a Laplace distribution. Especially in the case of Bitcoin.

パラメータ

xs (pandas.Series) -- Contains any real-valued data considered to follow the Laplace distribution.

fxtrade.analysis.estimate_brown_param(xs: Series) → float[ソース]¶

Return the scale parameter of Brownian motion assuming that the input follows to it. Unit time is 1 second.

パラメータ

xs (pandas.Series) -- Contains any real-valued data considered to follow the Brownian motion.

fxtrade.analysis.calc_brown_param(scale: float, dt: Timedelta) → float[ソース]¶

Return the variance of the Brownian motion at dt.

パラメータ

  • scale (float) -- Any positive float value. Use estimate_brown_param to estimate this parameter.

  • dt (pandas.Timedelta) -- Any positive pandas.Timedelta.

fxtrade.analysis.estimate_probability(xs: Series, window: int = 1, loc: Optional[float] = None, scale: Optional[float] = None) → Series[ソース]¶

Return the probability that the input will occur, assuming it follows a Laplace distribution with loc, scale as parameters. Parameters of the Laplace distribution are estimated from xs if not specified. By specifying a value greater than 1 for window, joint probability can be taken into account and more robust estimation can be performed.

パラメータ

  • xs (pd.Series) -- Contains any real-valued data considered to follow the Laplace distribution.

  • window (int, default 1) -- Size of the moving window. Recommends 3 to detect a spike or crash.

  • loc (float, optional) -- Location parameter of Laplace distribution.

  • scale (float, optional) -- Scale parameter of Laplace distribution.

fxtrade.analysis.analyze(xs: Series) → DataFrame[ソース]¶

Return a dataframe of the input itself, the time difference from the previous element, the logarithmic value, the log difference from the previous element, and the probability that the input will occur.

パラメータ

xs (pandas.Series) -- Contains historical price of the stock.

fxtrade.analysis.plot_laplace(xs: Series)[ソース]¶

Plot the fitted result assuming that the input follows a Laplace distribution.

パラメータ

xs (pandas.Series) -- Contains any real-valued data considered to follow the Laplace distribution.

fxtrade.stock module¶

Deals with stocks and operations on them.

fxtrade.stock.can_be_precise_num(x: Any) → bool[ソース]¶

Return whether the value can be calculated with precision.

fxtrade.stock.as_numeric(x: Any)[ソース]¶

Convert numbers to fractions.Fraction for accuracy.

class fxtrade.stock.Stock(code: str, q: Union[int, str, float, Fraction])[ソース]¶

ベースクラス: object

Stock consists from code and quantity.

__init__(code: str, q: Union[int, str, float, Fraction])[ソース]¶
パラメータ

  • code (str) -- Product code or name of the stock.

  • q (Numeric) -- Quantity of the stock.

property code: str¶

Return its code.

property q: Fraction¶

Return its quantity.

floor(n: int = 6)[ソース]¶

Return floor at the specified digit.

パラメータ

n (int, default 6) -- Specify the n-th decimal place. Must be non-negative number.

ceil(n: int = 0)[ソース]¶

Return ceil at the specified digit.

パラメータ

n (int, default 0) -- Specify the n-th decimal place. Must be non-negative number.

__abs__()[ソース]¶

Return absolute of the stock.

__pos__()[ソース]¶

Return positive of the stock.

__neg__()[ソース]¶

Return negative of the stock.

__lt__(other)[ソース]¶

Compare the stocks if the codes are the same. Else try to compare the stock quantity with the other.

__le__(other)[ソース]¶

Compare the stocks if the codes are the same. Else try to compare the stock quantity with the other.

__eq__(other)[ソース]¶

Compare the stocks if the codes are the same. Else try to compare the stock quantity with the other.

__ne__(other)[ソース]¶

Compare the stocks if the codes are the same. Else try to compare the stock quantity with the other.

__gt__(other)[ソース]¶

Compare the stocks if the codes are the same. Else try to compare the stock quantity with the other.

__ge__(other)[ソース]¶

Compare the stocks if the codes are the same. Else try to compare the stock quantity with the other.

__add__(other)[ソース]¶

Return sum of the stocks if the codes are the same. If the other is not instance of Stock, try to add the other to the stock quantity.

__radd__(other)[ソース]¶

Try to add the other to the stock quantity.

__sub__(other)[ソース]¶

Return difference between the stocks if the codes are the same. If the other is not instance of Stock, try to subtract the other from the stock quantity.

__rsub__(other)[ソース]¶

Try to subtract the stock quantity from the other.

__mul__(other)[ソース]¶

Try to multiply the other to the stock if the other is instance of Rate. Else try to multiply the other to the stock quantity.

__rmul__(other)[ソース]¶

Try to multiply the other to the stock quantity.

__truediv__(other)[ソース]¶

Try to multiply inverse of the other to the stock if the other is instance of Rate. Else try to divide the stock quantity by other.

__floordiv__(other)[ソース]¶

Try to divide the stock quantity by the other.

__mod__(other)[ソース]¶

Try to return the remainder of the stock quantity divided by the other.

__pow__(other, modulo=None)[ソース]¶

Try to return the stock powered by the other.

class fxtrade.stock.Rate(from_code: str, to_code: str, r: Union[int, str, float, Fraction])[ソース]¶

ベースクラス: object

Deal with the trading rate of the stock. Since the concept of large/small of rate is determined by the from_code and the to_code relatively, a large/small comparison is not supported.

classmethod from_stocks(before: Stock, after: Stock)[ソース]¶

Return the rate at which A is converted to B.

__init__(from_code: str, to_code: str, r: Union[int, str, float, Fraction])[ソース]¶
パラメータ

  • from_code (str) -- Product code before conversion.

  • to_code (str) -- Product code after conversion.

  • r (Numeric) -- Conversion rate.

property from_code¶

Product code before conversion.

property to_code¶

Product code after conversion.

property r¶

Conversion rate.

__invert__()[ソース]¶

Swap from_code and to_code, and take the reciprocal for r.

__eq__(other)[ソース]¶

True iff from_code, to_code, and r are all the same.

__ne__(other)[ソース]¶

Inverse of __eq__.

__mul__(other)[ソース]¶

Try to chain the other if it is instance of Rate. Else if the other is instance of Stock, try to convert with the rate. Else try to multiply the other to r.

__rmul__(other)[ソース]¶

Try to multiply the other to r.

__truediv__(other)[ソース]¶

Try to chain the ~other if it is instance of Rate. Else try to devide r by the other.

__pow__(other, modulo=None)[ソース]¶

Try to be powered by the other.

Return dataframe which is applied down sampling with specified interval. Data recorded at the halfway point will be deleted.

class fxtrade.trade.Trade(x: Stock, y: Stock, t: Optional[Timestamp] = None, order_id: Optional[str] = None)[ソース]¶

ベースクラス: object

Represent a single transaction. Consists from the stock before transaction and the stock after transaction.

static from_series(s: Series)[ソース]¶

Create Trade from pandas.Series. Columns must be pd.Index(['t', 'order_id', 'from', 'X(t)', 'to', 'Y(t+dt)', 'R(yt/xt)'])

static from_stock_and_rate(stock: Stock, rate: Rate, t=None, order_id=None)[ソース]¶

Create Trade from Stock and Rate.

__init__(x: Stock, y: Stock, t: Optional[Timestamp] = None, order_id: Optional[str] = None)[ソース]¶
パラメータ

  • x (Stock) -- The stock before the transaction.

  • y (Stock) -- The stock after the transaction.

  • t (pandas.Timestamp, optional) -- The time at which the transaction took place. If not specified, the current time will be set.

  • order_id (str, optional) -- Order ID.

property x: Stock¶

The stock before the transaction.

property y: Stock¶

The stock after the transaction.

property rate: Rate¶

The rate at the transaction.

as_series() → Series[ソース]¶

Convert to pandas.Series.

split_x(x: Stock)[ソース]¶

Split a trade by x into two trades.

split_y(y: Stock)[ソース]¶

Split a trade by y into two trades.

split(z: Stock)[ソース]¶

Split a trade into two trades. Whether it is divided by x or y is automatically determined by the code.

settle(trade)[ソース]¶

Calculate the confirmed profit and remaining unrealized profit from the two trades.

xfloor(n=0)[ソース]¶

Truncate the pre-trade stock on the specified digit.

yfloor(n=6)[ソース]¶

Truncate the post-trade stock on the specified digit.

floor(n=6)[ソース]¶

Truncate the post-trade stock on the specified digit.

xceil(n=0)[ソース]¶

Round up the pre-trade stock on the specified digit.

yceil(n=6)[ソース]¶

Round up the post-trade stock on the specified digit.

ceil(n=6)[ソース]¶

Round up the post-trade stock on the specified digit.

__mul__(other)[ソース]¶

Try to multiply the other to both x and y.

__truediv__(other)[ソース]¶

Try to devide by the other to both x and y.

__floordiv__(other)[ソース]¶

Try to devide by the other to both x and y and calculate floor().

__mod__(other)[ソース]¶

Try to devide by the other to both x and y and calculate ceil().

class fxtrade.trade.TradePair(before: Trade, after: Trade)[ソース]¶

ベースクラス: object

Pair of transactions with confirmed profit or loss.

static from_series(s)[ソース]¶

Create TradePair from pandas.Series. Columns must be pd.Index(['before_id', 'after_id', 's', 't', 'X(s)', 'Y(s+ds)=Y(t)', 'Z(t+dt)', 'code_X', 'code_Y', 'code_Z', 'R(ys/xs)', 'R(zt/yt)', 'R(zt/xs)']).

__init__(before: Trade, after: Trade)[ソース]¶
パラメータ

  • before (Trade) -- A trade you made.

  • after (Trade) -- A trade in which profit or loss are determined.

as_series()[ソース]¶

Convert to pandas.Series.
